context: Beyoncé's music is generally <a0_0><a5_0><a9_0>R&B<a9_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/>, but she also incorporates <a1_0>pop, soul and funk<a1_0/> into her songs. 4 demonstrated Beyoncé's exploration of 90s-style R&B, as well as further use of soul and hip hop than compared to previous releases. While she almost exclusively releases <a6_0>English<a6_0/> songs, Beyoncé recorded several <a2_0><a7_0><a10_0>Spanish<a10_0/><a7_0/><a2_0/> songs for Irreemplazable (re-recordings of songs from <a8_0>B'Day<a8_0/> for a Spanish-language audience), and the <a3_0>re-release of <a12_0>B'Day<a3_0/>.<a12_0/> To record these, Beyoncé was coached phonetically by American record producer <a4_0><a11_0>Rudy Perez<a4_0/>.
